profiles:
Summary • Recently completed my bachelor degree in psychology from the University of Southern California after an 10-year hiatus - took a full load of five courses in one semester and achieved a 3.4 grade point average, while also taking care my two sons, ages 2 and 4; my husband stayed back home due to work 
•	Over five years wine industry experience, having held various positions in writing, service and retail management  
•	Over three years sales/customer service experience, in the entertainment and retail industries, ensuring positive customer experience, displaying correct product knowledge, and enhancing teamwork and productivity 
•	Four years increased administrative experience, demonstrating leadership, resourcefulness, communication and interpersonal skills, project management coordination, and organization skills 
•	Competent in financial administration, specifically accounts payable, budgeting, procurement, reimbursement 
•	Experienced in event coordination, including but not limited to, catering, facilities, audio/visual equipment 
• Working knowledge of merchandise buying and planning: Basic Stock Method; Percentage Variation Method; Weeks Supply Method; Stock-to-sales method 
• Working knowledge of specific pricing strategies: customary, variable, flexible, price lining, multi-unit pricing; Working knowledge of markups; can formulate merchandising budget

Specialties: Retail, Hospitality, Wine Events, Wine Retail Management, Wine Service, Wine Writing, Administration, Social Media, Consumer Behavior, Business Experience Volunteer Reading Tutor University of Southern California January 2014  –  May 2014  (5 months) Greater Los Angeles Area As part of my Child's Learning and Cognitive Development course, we were trained to be a reading tutor and tutored a child (k-5) in reading for 8 weeks. I increased my mentee's reading scores by 30%. Founder & Editor Niche Wine Blog 2006  –  2011  (5 years) Niche Wine Blog began as Wine: Uncorked in 2006. I mostly share wine reviews, book reviews, industry news and events. I plan to incorporate topics related to sustainability and organic wine, as well as wine marketing/branding. Founder & Editor Wine Mindshare 2010  –  2010  (less than a year) Founded in 2010, Wine Mindshare is a blog focused on reaching the next generation of wine consumers. Wine Mindshare is a formative blog reviewing wineries, importers, distributors, retailers, restaurants, wine communications companies and other industry representatives, publishing breaking news on what’s new in wine industry communications. We analyze wine industry trends, such as sales and marketing, brands, public relations and social media. Assistant Retail Manager 58 Degrees & Holding May 2008  –  January 2009  (9 months) •	Assisted with management operations – open/close duties, buying, merchandising, inventory, supervised 5 employees 
•	Coordinated and lead on and off site wine tasting events/education seminars, private and for business 
•	Assisted in selecting wines for new wine lists, managed inventory and purchased wines for retail shop and ordered wine and maintained inventory for bar stock in bistro 
 
**Tucson, AZ location closed at the end of January 2009 due to poor economy. Volunteer Wine Educator Left Bank Restaurant June 2007  –  August 2007  (3 months) Trained Left Bank restaurant staff, with other classmates, on wine service, food & wine pairing, and wine sales techniques, resulting in a 30% increase in wine sales, while studying at the Professional Culinary Institute Academic Affairs Coordinator Stanford University June 2006  –  June 2007  (1 year 1 month) •	Project Manager of Curriculum Committee – moderated meetings; oversaw maintenance and future planning of course curriculum, making sure all required courses were taught without scheduling conflicts for 11 faculty members 
•	Assisted with financial administration – travel and reimbursements, accounts payable, petty cash 
•	Supervised 2 work-study students 
•	Responsible for coordinating international visiting scholar logistics 
•	Coordinated catered events for department 
 
** Left position to study wine and become a certified sommelier Admission Coordinator University of Southern California September 2005  –  March 2006  (7 months) •	Acted as primary liaison between the Office of Admission and the School’s faculty to streamline complex faculty review process of applicant files; screened applicants for admission to Music Industry Program 
•	Principal administrative support for Director and Associate Directors of Admission and Financial Aid 
•	Supervised 4 work-study students 
•	Involved with coordination and representation of on-campus recruitment events for TSOM 
•	Collaborated with marketing manager to create and place advertisements in industry publications resulting in increased awareness of school program and admission application submissions 
 
**Left this position due to relocating to Northern California Crew Member/Floral Mgr Trader Joe's December 2004  –  July 2005  (8 months) •	Upheld company philosophy of “customers are king” via creating a genuine, fun shopping experience by welcoming customers, building individual relationships and acquiring new product knowledge to share 
•	Acquired specialized knowledge of the floral section within three weeks of hire, resulting in order management, inventory control, display maintenance, and providing floral advice to customers 
 
** Left this position to work at the University of Southern California Administrative Assistant/Receptionist to Dean, Thornton School of Music (part time/temp) University of Southern California March 2004  –  June 2004  (4 months) •	Performed various clerical functions - managed multi-line phone system, generated correspondence, coordinated meetings, arranged travel plans, and helped coordinate events for graduation 
•	Portrayed excellent customer service and interpersonal skills when interacting with the high-profile individuals who associated with the Dean, striving to uphold the reputation of the School and University Assistant Administrator St. James' Episcopal Church - Los Angeles January 2001  –  July 2003  (2 years 7 months) •	Performed various clerical functions, utilizing communication and interpersonal skills 
•	Maintained the files of and built rapport with new attendees, resulting in increased membership to church  
•	Displayed leadership, initiative, and resourcefulness upon acting as parish administrator for an extended period of time on short notice resulting in continued successful function of the parish office and church Volunteer Reading Tutor University of Southern California January 2014  –  May 2014  (5 months) Greater Los Angeles Area As part of my Child's Learning and Cognitive Development course, we were trained to be a reading tutor and tutored a child (k-5) in reading for 8 weeks. I increased my mentee's reading scores by 30%. Summary I’ve had the opportunity to work in many different levels and capacities in Silicon Valley companies. These include project management, vendor management and negotiations, event planning for onsite and virtual sessions, and cross-functional coordination. 
 
-Solid interpersonal and negotiation skills, team-oriented attitude, diplomatic, personable with a sense of humor 
-Superior multi-tasking skills, adaptive to fast-paced and changing environments, ability to take the complicated and create simple but powerful solutions 
-Strong project management skills 
-Resourceful, self-reliant with strong organizational and time-management skills, meticulous attention to detail 
-Proactive, professional working style to communicate progress and anticipate for changing needs 
-Excellent written and verbal communications skills Summary I’ve had the opportunity to work in many different levels and capacities in Silicon Valley companies. -Excellent written and verbal communications skills Experience Administrative Business Partner Google October 2014  – Present (11 months) Administrative Assistant Cisco Systems December 2007  – Present (7 years 9 months) Executive Support 
 
-Provide full administrative support to multiple Sr. Directors within the Worldwide Sales Enablement organizations: Operations Strategy and Planning and Transformation Office. Previously supported Directors within Global Briefings and Proposals and Global Demonstration Services. 
-Manage daily operations which include: heavy calendar management; scheduling domestic & international travel; receiving visitors; scheduling and planning for meetings, conference calls & special events, arrangement of logistics meeting space, communications and catering, etc., for internal and external meetings with cultural sensitivity. 
-Trusted advisor to executives with proxies to manage and accelerate the timely approval of requests pertaining to Compensation Planner, HRMS, Cisco Travel Network, and purchase requisitions. 
-Track and manage the committed deliverables of the team to ensure goal achievement and acceleration of deliverables. 
-A proven professional reputation, with a consistent history of exemplary performance reviews and recognition for assisting with and minimizing my executives team workload. 
 
Project Management 
 
Rewards and Recognition GameChanger Program- Awarded to individuals and teams who deliver game-changing impact and standout results that significantly benefit Sales Enablement, our sales, partner and services stakeholders. 
-Defining and documentation of the process. 
-Initiate the opening and closing of nomination period.  
-Data analysis of results & metrics in a consumable format for Sr. Management. 
-Proactively manage and maintain organizational announcements, WebEx Social posts, & process documentation. 
-Interact and collaborate with all level of executives, employees within the organization, and cross-functional partners. 
 
Initiatives- Collaborate with cross functional teams on customized relevant initiatives: 
-Inclusion and Diversity program for GDS 
-Executive Briefing Center (EBC) Audio Wand Tour 
-Global Sales Meeting Administrative Assistant Cisco Systems 2007  –  2007  (less than a year) Cisco Systems, Inc. -Provided a complete range of administrative support. 
-Assisted manager in tracking the team’s budget. 
-Reviewed SOW’s prior to final submission to meet specific requirements and work in collaboration with financial liaison to ensure processing. 
-Worked in partnership with theaters to compile Sales Masters Series global implementation schedule of tracks.  
-Supported the Sales Onboarding team during monthly resource expo. 
-Organized team off sites to include meeting logistics and team building activities. Software Licensing Administrator Spansion 2006  –  2007  (1 year) -Worked with vendors, resellers, license team, and engineering to maintain software license capacity, meet user needs and maintain compliance with contract terms. Purchased required software where there was an insufficient supply. 
-Supported users of CAD/EDA licenses with reports, requirement gathering, and other communication. 
-Managed and fulfilled Remedy Software Request Queue- required reviewing, reassignment, and approval of license. 
-Processed monthly chargeback of software costs to respective user cost centers. 
-Retained database with deployed and retired applications to analyze users’ future business needs. 
-Collaborated with license team, IT, Finance, Tax, and Procurement to develop guidelines and procedures. Executive Assistant to Senior Vice President Infosys July 2000  –  March 2006  (5 years 9 months) -Provided a complete range of administrative support, interacted with all levels of the organization and acted as a liaison to executives and customers, handled and maintained highly confidential and sensitive information. 
-Coordinated and managed all aspects of the CEO’s quarterly visit to the U.S. and worked in collaboration with the Sales teams, Executive Assistants, and Marketing across independent business units to arrange meetings with customers, analysts, and the press. 
- Planned and managed event logistics for Annual Client Services Meeting attended by 400+ participants with a budget of $300K+; negotiate prices for hotels, caterers, and entertainment. 
- Monitored internal databases on customers, revenues, and project status and managed the content of internal Sales portal.
